newsitem.title: USA: US mortgage-backeds a touch higher with Treasuries.
newsitem.headline: US mortgage-backeds a touch higher with Treasuries.

text.p: U.S. mortgage-backed securities meandered higher in thin trading Thursday, market experts said.
Spreads over Treasuries were wider at midday but slightly tighter by late afternoon, when Treasuries gave up some of their earlier gains.
Pass-throughs were 1/32 to 4/32 higher, with activity concentraded in mid-range coupons, traders said.
"All I saw today was a decent seller of Ginnie 8.0s," said one trader at a large bank.
In late trading, Ginnie Mae 30-year 7.5-percent paper was up 5/32 at 99-19/32, yielding 99 basis points over the 10-year Treasury note.
Comparable Fannie Mae issues were up 3/32 at 99-18/32, and Freddie Macs were up 4/32 at 99-26/32.
The 10-year Treasury note was up 1/32 at 6.67 percent.
U.S. fixed-income markets got off to a rocky start after reports showed core consumer prices were up 0.3 percent, a tick higher than expected, and weekly jobless claims posted a significant decline.
But the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia's business outlook index, released at 1000 EDT/1400 GMT, read 1.6 in May against 5.7 in April. Economists had projected an index reading of 7.4.
